en.title: How Kitten Prices Are Determined | Reasons for Price Differences by Pedigree, Coat Color, and Gender
en.content:
To answer the question "Why is this kitten priced this way?", let us explain the factors that determine a kitten's price.

Pedigree and Lineage

Kittens from champion bloodlines are priced higher. Prices may also differ between show quality (potential to win at shows) and pet quality (for families).

Coat Color and Pattern

Popular colors and rare colorings tend to be more expensive. Among Siberians, the Neva Masquerade (point coloring) is especially popular.

Gender

Generally, females tend to be slightly more expensive. This is influenced by demand for breeding purposes.

Breeder Management Costs

Proper health management (genetic testing, vaccinations, regular checkups), quality food, adequate space and environmental maintenance, and socialization training all incur costs. The price reflects this quality of care.

Caution with Extremely Low-Priced Kittens

If the price is significantly below market average, health management may be inadequate or there may be issues with the breeding environment. Considering long-term medical costs, purchasing from a trusted breeder at a fair price is ultimately the better value.

zh.title: 小猫价格的决定因素 | 血统、毛色、性别导致价格差异的原因
zh.content:
为了解答“为什么这只小猫是这个价格？”的疑问，我们来解析决定小猫价格的各项因素。

血统与家系

冠军血统的小猫价格较高。赛级品质（有参赛获奖潜力）与宠物级品质（家庭饲养用）的价格也会有所不同。

毛色与花纹

人气高的毛色和稀有配色往往价格更高。在西伯利亚猫中，涅瓦化妆舞会色（重点色）尤其受欢迎。

性别

一般来说，母猫的价格略高。这受到繁殖需求的影响。

繁殖者的管理成本

完善的健康管理（基因检测、疫苗接种、定期体检）、优质猫粮、充足的空间和环境维护、社会化训练都需要成本投入。价格反映了这些饲养品质。

价格过低的小猫需要警惕

如果价格大幅低于市场行情，可能存在健康管理不到位或繁殖环境有问题的情况。考虑到长期的医疗费用，从值得信赖的繁殖者处以合理价格领养，最终反而更划算。
